title: IWeldmentBeadFeatureData.ISetFaces
description: Sets the faces to which to apply the weld bead.
signature:
System.Boolean ISetFaces( 
   System.Int32
Side
,
   System.Int32
Count1
,
   ref Face2
FaceSet1
,

Count2
,

FaceSet2
)

parameters.name: Count1
parameters.description: Number of faces in the first set of faces

parameters.name: FaceSet1
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of the first set of faces VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported See In-process Methods for details about this type of method.

parameters.name: Count2
parameters.description: Number of faces in the second set of faces

parameters.name: FaceSet2
parameters.description: in-process, unmanaged C++: Pointer to an array of the second set of faces VBA, VB.NET, C#, and C++/CLI: Not supported

returns: True if the weld bead is applied to the specified faces, false if not
remarks:
Although you must select planar faces for the face sets, fillet weld beads can follow non-planar, tangent contours when you set
IWeldmentBeadFeatureData::TangentPropagation
to TRUE.
See
Accessing Selections that Define Features
for additional details.
